disagreement or debate (= formal discussion of a topic on which people disagree): In religious disputation, there is no place for insult or invective. This led to long legal disputations. See
dispute
More examplesFewer examplesThere will soon be no need for disputation on the future of the National Health Service because it will effectively have ceased to exist. The show is a mix of philosophical disputation and broad satire. The reformation was the great religious disputation that convulsed 16th-century Europe. People need to be taught facts before they can engage in disputations.
